Part 2: Construct a second rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 * Translation Vector: 0.525, 0.375, 0.1875 Next, create a sketch with the following details: * Face: 1 * Loop: 1 * Line: 1 + Start Point: 0.0, 0.0 + End Point: 0.375, 0.0 * Line: 2 + Start Point: 0.375, 0.0 + End Point: 0.375, 0.0975 * Line: 3 + Start Point: 0.375, 0.0975 + End Point: 0.0, 0.0975 * Line: 4 + Start Point: 0.0, 0.0975 + End Point: 0.0, 0.0 Then, extrude the sketch with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.525 * Sketch scale: 0.375 * Operation: Join Note: The dimensions of the prism are 2 units by 4 units by 6 units. Part 3: Construct a tapered prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: 90.0, 0.0, -90.0 * Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.75, 0.285 Next, create a sketch with the following details: * Face: 1 * Loop: 1 * Line: 1 + Start Point: 0.0, 0.0 + End Point: 0.375, 0.0 * Line: 2 + Start Point: 0.375, 0.0 + End Point: 0.375, 0.09 * Line: 3 + Start Point: 0.375, 0.09 + End Point: 0.0, 0.09 * Line: 4 + Start Point: 0.0, 0.09 + End Point: 0.0, 0.0 Then, extrude the sketch with the following properties: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.3 * Sketch scale: 0.375 * Operation: Join Note: The height of the prism is approximately twice the width, and the length of the shorter side is about half the length of the longer side.</description>
